Package com.passwordmanager.storage

Class VaultSession

java.lang.Object
com.passwordmanager.storage.VaultSession
public final class VaultSession extends Object
Manages the unlocked state of the vault as a strict state machine.

State Transitions: 

 [LOCKED] --unlock(keyBytes)--> [UNLOCKED]
 [UNLOCKED] --lock()--> [LOCKED]

Invariants:

  • The vault is LOCKED by default
  • When LOCKED, vaultSessionKey is null
  • When UNLOCKED, vaultSessionKey contains a valid AES-256 key
  • Calling unlock() when already unlocked throws IllegalStateException
  • Calling getVaultSessionKey() when locked throws IllegalStateException
  • All key material is zeroized on lock()

This class uses static methods to represent a single global vault session. In future versions, this could be refactored to support multiple vault instances.

Security Guarantees:

  • Session keys exist in memory only while vault is unlocked
  • Keys are zeroized immediately upon locking
  • No operations possible on locked vault
  • State transitions are atomic and fail-safe

  • Method Details

    • unlock

      public static void unlock(byte[] keyBytes)
      Unlocks the vault using the provided key bytes.

      The key bytes are wrapped in a SecretKey (AES) for session use. The caller is responsible for clearing the input keyBytes array after this method returns.

      Preconditions:

      • Vault must be locked
      • keyBytes must be exactly 32 bytes (256 bits)
      • keyBytes must not be null
      Parameters:
      keyBytes - the derived key bytes to unlock the vault (must be 32 bytes for AES-256)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the vault is already unlocked
      IllegalArgumentException - if keyBytes is null or not 32 bytes

    • lock

      public static void lock()
      Locks the vault and securely wipes all key material from memory.

      Once locked, no operations using the vault key are allowed until it is unlocked again. This method is idempotent - calling it on an already-locked vault is safe.

      Security Note: This method attempts to extract and zeroize the raw key bytes from the SecretKey. While this works for SecretKeySpec, some SecretKey implementations may not expose raw bytes. In such cases, only the reference is cleared.

    • isUnlocked

      public static boolean isUnlocked()
      Returns whether the vault is currently unlocked.

      This method is thread-safe and can be called at any time.

      Returns:
      true if the vault is unlocked, false otherwise

    • getVaultSessionKey

      public static SecretKey getVaultSessionKey()
      Returns the SecretKey representing the current vault session key.

      This method can only be called when the vault is unlocked.

      Security Warning: The returned key should NEVER be serialized, logged, or persisted. It should only be used for in-memory cryptographic operations during the current session.

      Returns:
      the AES SecretKey for the current session
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the vault is locked

    • getState

      public static String getState()
      Returns the current lock state as a string for debugging.

      Warning: This method does NOT expose key material, only the state.

      Returns:
      "LOCKED" or "UNLOCKED"
